biography.value:
Once a celebrated chef known for his unique take on classic comfort foods, Bartholomew 'Barty' Bunton delved too deep into forbidden culinary arts. Seeking the ultimate flavor, he performed a ritual that fused him with his magnum opus: the perfect hamburger. Now a monstrous aberration, The Gourmand wanders the planes, eternally seeking to 'perfect' its form by consuming sentient beings, transforming them into ingredients for its own grotesque existence.

Behavior: The Gourmand is driven by an insatiable hunger, not for itself, but for the consumption of others into its own form. It uses its condiment attacks to incapacitate and confuse prey before attempting to engulf them. It is particularly drawn to those who express a fondness for food.

Appearance: A grotesque, humanoid-shaped amalgamation of a hamburger. Its body is formed from a massive, sizzling beef patty, encased within a slightly charred brioche bun. Condiment dispensers resembling eyes or mouths protrude from its form, ready to spray their noxious payloads.

Twist: Despite its monstrous appearance, the Gourmand retains fragmented memories of its past life as a beloved chef, and occasionally speaks in culinary terms or offers nonsensical cooking advice.

Habitat: Unknown

Treasure: A pouch containing 30 gp and a vial of exceptionally rare truffle oil.

description.value: As a bonus action, [[lookup @name lowercase]] can target one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute. The charmed target regards [[lookup @name lowercase]] as a delicious meal and is unwilling to attack it. The effect ends if [[lookup @name lowercase]] or its allies do anything harmful to the target. [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have only one creature charmed in this way at a time.

When [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes piercing or slashing damage, it sprays a small amount of greasy juices. Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.
A magically preserved, searingly hot hamburger patty that forms the core of the creature.
The creature's outer shell, providing natural armor.
A ranged attack that can blind or nauseate.
A ranged attack that can slow or entangle.
A ranged attack that can cause confusion or fear.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using CHA as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: Acid Splash, Vicious Mockery

3/Day Each: Grease

2/Day Each: Ray of Sickness, Blindness/Deafness

1/Day Each: Slow

You hurl a bubble of acid. Choose one creature you can see within range, or choose two creatures you can see within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6acid damage.

This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point within range and turns it into difficult terrain for the duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

materials.value: A bit of pork rind or butter

description.value:
You can blind or deafen a foe. Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target is either &Reference[blinded] or &Reference[deafened] (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

effects.name: Blindness
effects.description: The target is Blinded for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

effects.name: Deafness
effects.description: The target is Deafened for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

description.value:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a d20. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted.

A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of its turn. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

effects.name: Slow
effects.description: An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.
